text: <@U3T21PDBK> You'll also run into CORS issues with this if you are doing it across domains, but you can use jquery's `$.load()` to get the actual SVG code of the file directly into your html. This can be a lot more useful if you want to manipulate colors for hover transitions or individual elements for animation purposes.

For anyone interested, you'd essentially just create a placeholder div for your SVG (like `<div id="logo"><img src="/assets/png/fallback-image.png"></div>` and then use `$('#logo').load('/assets/svg/logo.svg');` to load the contents of the SVG file directly into that div.
